list_definition.definition: of the earth’s North or South Pole or the region around it

list_ex_of_english: Note that the polar regions are not included.
Lateral flagella were not clearly visible, but 2-5 polar flagella (2-3 times the length of the cell) were observed.
If they all turn up to the right of the verb in their canonical positions, you must be looking at a polar query.
The formation of the polar capsule seems to take place as usual in myxosporeans.
There was even some evidence of a 'wave of darkening' spreading from the waning polar cap towards the equator.
Interpretation of radio echo sounding in polar ice sheets.
The kinetics of polar body formation were also fastest in pyruvate-containing medium.
Three polar assumptions about economic openness are successively handled.
